author: jameshe5018

content: looks like you are not logged into dockerhub?

author: jameshe5018
content:
hmm weird i am logged in , someone online said change the     "credsStore": "desktop", to    "credStore": "desktop", for docker/config.json no idea how that changed in the first place.
got me a little further

author: jameshe5018
content: do you guys use lens or some other tool outside of dockerdesktop + extensions to interact with the containers launched from kurtosis?

author: jameshe5018
content: I want to be able to see the logs side by side, i don't think docker desktop lets you do that

author: parithosh
content:
We normally just use the docker cli ðŸ˜›
Open two panes in your terminal and docker logs ... -f --tail=20 on both of them

author: parithosh
content: docker logs ... 2>&1 | grep "search term" to search through logs

author: taku8797
content:
Hi all! 

I'm exploring using Kurtosis to deploy a single cl and el node pair on a google kubernetes engine. The idea is to have others also deploy their own single GKE node pairs and we can connect and peer up using loadbalancer services. 

The issue I'm having is that the genesis file created differs when I run the kurtosis command to create this setup on a gke using github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package. I have narrowed the difference being caused by the *timestamp* field that is inserted by the ethereum-genesis-generator. 

Is there a way to use an already existing genesis file when spinning up a network using kurtosis?

Thanks!

author: barnabasbusa
content: Can you paste your config file here that you are running.

author: barnabasbusa
content: We are not aware of any kubernetes bugs that would involve the timestamp fields

author: barnabasbusa
content: also which timestamp field is incorrect ?

author: barnabasbusa
content: The only supported method is currently to use a brand new network, an existing devnet (hosted by us), and existing testnet, like sepolia, hoodi or mainnet.

author: taku8797
content:
<@412614104222531604> This is my kurtosis config file:
```
config-version: 2
should-send-metrics: true
kurtosis-clusters:
  docker:
    type: "docker"
  minikube:
    type: "kubernetes"
    config:
      kubernetes-cluster-name: "minikube"
      storage-class: "standard"
      enclave-size-in-megabytes: 10
  cloud:
    type: "kubernetes"
    config:
      kubernetes-cluster-name: "ethereum-cluster"
      storage-class: "standard"
      enclave-size-in-megabytes: 10000
```
And this is my network parameter file:
```
participants:
  - el_type: geth
    el_log_level: "trace"
    cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_log_level: "trace"
    count: 1
network_params:
  network_id: "9223372036854"
  prefunded_accounts: '{"0xf39Fd6e51aad88F6F4ce6aB8827279cffFb92266":{ "balance": "10000000ETH" }}'
additional_services:
  - dora
```

author: taku8797
content: Sorry the timestamp is in the genesis file so it is for the creation of the genesis block. The only way then for a new network spun by kurtosis to have the same genesis file as another network spun by kurtosis is if somehow I can specify the genesis file to use when I call `kurtosis run`. I'm not sure if this is possible?
